title: [Validator] UniqueEntityValidator can't validate values of proxy objects
body: If you have an association and have that as one of your fields for using the SymfonyBridgeDoctrineValidatorConstraintsUniqueEntityValidator the unique validation wont work if your object is a proxy and hasn't had the identifier field hydrated yet.rnrnI didn't know how to put this into a unit test but did work out a very crude fix in the validator that i'm sure isn't suitable to be a patch but I think helps illustrate the problem better.rnrn```phprn            if (isset($class->associationMappings[$fieldName])) {rnrn                // very crude fix to the problemrn                if ($criteria[$fieldName] instanceof DoctrineORMProxyProxy) {rn                    $criteria[$fieldName]->__load();rn                }rnrn                $relatedClass = $em->getClassMetadata($class->associationMappings[$fieldName]['targetEntity']);rn                $relatedId = $relatedClass->getIdentifierValues($criteria[$fieldName]);rnrn                if (count($relatedId) > 1) {rn                    throw new ConstraintDefinitionException(sprintf('Associated entities are not allowed to have more than one identifier field to be part of a unique constraint in %s#%s.', $class->name, $fieldName));rn                }rn                $criteria[$fieldName] = array_pop($relatedId);rn            }rnrn```rnrnI experienced this on Symfony 2.0.9, running on OS X Lion

title: [Validator] UniqueEntityValidator can't validate values of proxy objects
body: If you have an association and have that as one of your fields for using the SymfonyBridgeDoctrineValidatorConstraintsUniqueEntityValidator the unique validation wont work if your object is a proxy and hasn't had the identifier field hydrated yet.rnrnI didn't know how to put this into a unit test but did work out a very crude fix in the validator that i'm sure isn't suitable to be a patch but I think helps illustrate the problem better.rnrn```phprn            if (isset($class->associationMappings[$fieldName])) {rnrn                // very crude fix to the problemrn                if ($criteria[$fieldName] instanceof DoctrineORMProxyProxy) {rn                    $criteria[$fieldName]->__load();rn                }rnrn                $relatedClass = $em->getClassMetadata($class->associationMappings[$fieldName]['targetEntity']);rn                $relatedId = $relatedClass->getIdentifierValues($criteria[$fieldName]);rnrn                if (count($relatedId) > 1) {rn                    throw new ConstraintDefinitionException(sprintf('Associated entities are not allowed to have more than one identifier field to be part of a unique constraint in %s#%s.', $class->name, $fieldName));rn                }rn                $criteria[$fieldName] = array_pop($relatedId);rn            }rnrn```rnrnI experienced this on Symfony 2.0.9, running on OS X Lion

title: [Form] 'NaN' string is mapped to a decimal field as a float(NaN)
body: I followed the tutorial at http://symfony.com/doc/current/book/doctrine.html and after that generated CRUD.rnrnThe `price` member looks like:rnrn    /**rn     * @var decimal $pricern     *rn     * @ORMColumn(name=u201dpriceu201d, type=u201ddecimalu201d, nullable=false)rn     */rn    private $price;rnrnIf we specify `NaN` as a price form value - form is treated as **valid** and we get a warning from loggerrnrn    Warning: [json] (php_json_encode) double NAN does not conform to the JSON spec, encoded as 0 in /var/www/sf/vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Bridge/Doctrine/Logger/DbalLogger.php line 44rnrnI think that string `NaN` should be treated as invalid decimal value thus form should be treated as invalidrnrnPS: this is a dump of an object after validation and right before persisting (and logging)rnrn    object(AcmeStoreBundleEntityProduct)#654 (4) { [u201didu201d:u201dAcmeStoreBundleEntityProductu201d:private]=> int(1) [u201dnameu201d:u201dAcmeStoreBundleEntityProductu201d:private]=> string(3) u201dFoou201d [u201dpriceu201d:u201dAcmeStoreBundleEntityProductu201d:private]=> float(NAN) [u201ddescriptionu201d:u201dAcmeStoreBundleEntityProductu201d:private]=> string(1) u201dau201d }

title: [Form] MoneyType regexp broken for JPY
body: The regexp in MoneyType doesn't work if currency format has no decimal (like JPY) and doesn't work either if the currency symbol is unicodernthe following patch should fix both problems :rnrn    ===================================================================rn    --- vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/Form/Extension/Core/Type/MoneyType.phpt(revision )rn    +++ vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/Form/Extension/Core/Type/MoneyType.phpt(revision )rn    @@ -100,7 +100,7 @@rn     rn                 // the regex also considers non-break spaces (0xC2 or 0xA0 in UTF-8)rn     rn    -            preg_match('/^([^sxc2xa0]*)[sxc2xa0]*123[,.]00[sxc2xa0]*([^sxc2xa0]*)$/', $pattern, $matches);rn    +            preg_match('/^([^sxc2xa0]*)[sxc2xa0]*123[,.]*[0]*[sxc2xa0]*([^sxc2xa0]*)$/u', $pattern, $matches);rn     rn                 if (!empty($matches[1])) {rn                     self::$patterns[Locale::getDefault()] = $matches[1].' {{ widget }}';rn

title: [BrowserKit] CookieJar can't parse multiple cookies from Set-Cookie
body: `CookieJar::updateFromResponse()` assumes that each `Set-Cookie` header contains only one cookie:rnhttps://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/BrowserKit/CookieJar.php#L97rnrnThis is wrong since the following is a valid header defining three cookies (foo=1, bar=2, PHPSESSID=id):rn`Set-Cookie: foo=1; expires=Fri, 13 Jan 2012 11:04:36 GMT; domain=.example.org, bar=2; expires=Fri, 13 Jan 2012 11:04:36 GMT; domain=.example.org, PHPSESSID=id; expires=Fri, 13 Jan 2012 11:04:36 GMT`rnrnAnother error is that this header is parsed to a cookie `foo` with domain `.example.org, bar=2`.

title: [Form][Guesser] Incorrect Form Field Guessing And/Or Validation
body: Hi, rnrnWhen I make a form from an entity class with this property:rnrn```rn/**rn * @AssertNotBlank()rn * @AssertMin(u201d-.5u201d)rn * @AssertMax(u201d.5u201d)rn */rnprotected $numericProperty;rn```rnrnSymfony adds a ```pattern=u201d.{3,2}u201d``` attribute to the HTML `<input>` in the view, which is obviously not right. The pattern attribute is still added even if I ```@AssertType(u201dfloatu201d)``` or ```@AssertType(u201dnumericu201d)```.rnrn(Note that if I leave out the quotation marks in ```@AssertMin``` and ```AssertMax``` I get an error.)rnrnIf I explicitly specify the field as optional or as a number type when I add it to the form builder, then the ```pattern``` attribute goes away (as expected), but another problem crops up: I can't specify a positive number without a leading digit (e.g. u201d.3u201d). When I do so, I get the error: rnrn> Expected argument of type u201dnumericu201d, u201dbooleanu201d given in vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/Form/Extension/Core/DataTransformer/NumberToLocalizedStringTransformer.php at line 73rnrnThe validation constraints are working though: if I enter a number outside of -.5 and .5, I get the appropriate error, and .3 is accepted if I enter it as 0.3.rnrnBoth of the ```pattern``` attribute and the requirement for a leading 0 weren't behaviors I was expecting. But maybe I'm missing something?

title: Locale::getDisplayCountries() does not return all countries for 5-letter locales
body: When a 5-letter locale (e.g. de_CH) ist set, SymfonyComponentLocaleLocale::getDisplayCountries() does not return the full country list but only the countries that are special for the specific locale.rnrnThis is only the case when there is in fact a special resource file for this locale. For fr_CH for instance, fr is used as the fallback and the full list is returned. rnrnSomething like the following code seems to solve the issue, although it looks a little hacky so I am not sure if this is the right way.rnrntnamespace SymfonyComponentLocale;rnrntclass Locale extends Localernt{rnttstatic public function getDisplayCountries($locale)rntt{rnttt// ...rntt    rntt    if (strlen($locale) == 5) {rntt    t$countries = self::getDisplayCountries(substr($locale, 0, 2));rntt    } else {rntt        $countries = array();rntt    }rntt    rnttt// ...rntt}rnt}

title: [Form][Guesser] The prototype is an empty string for a collection which is not one-to-many
body: The prototype is an empty string for a collection which is not backed by one-to-many relationshiprnrn```phprn{% debug form_widget(form.extraAttributes.get('prototype')) %}rn```rnreturns `string(0) u201du201d`rnrnrnbuildForm methodrnrn```phprn$builderrn            ->add('images', 'collection', array('type' => new ProductimageType(), 'allow_add' => true, 'allow_delete' => true, 'label'=> 'Imagini', 'prototype' => true ))rn            ->add('extraAttributes', 'collection', array('type' => 'hidden', 'allow_add' => true, 'allow_delete' => true, 'label'=> 'Attribute', 'prototype' => true))rn        ;rn```rn`images` ,which is one-to-many relationship in Doctrine2, displays the prototype properly, whereas `extraAttributes` prototype is emptyrnrnrnField definitions:rnrn```phprn /**rn     * @ORMOneToMany(targetEntity=u201dProductimageu201d, mappedBy=u201dproductu201d, orphanRemoval=true, cascade={u201dpersistu201d})rn     */rn    private $images;rnrn  /**rn     * @var arrayrn     * @ORMColumn(name=u201dOtheru201d, type=u201darrayu201d, nullable=true)rn     */rn    private $extraAttributes;rn```rnrnI add rnrn```htmlrn<input class=u201dform-hiddenu201d type=u201dhiddenu201d id=u201dproduct_extraAttributes_0_typeu201d name=u201dproduct[extraAttributes][0][type]u201d>rn```rnmanually via javascript, and the engine properly adds fields as intended, so basically everything works except the prototype generation.rn

title: [Form] FormTypeCsrfExtension replaces any existent csrf field
body: Form::setData dispachtes the PRE_SET_DATA event that is caught by the FormTypeCsrfExtension and invokes the EnsureCsrfFieldListener::ensureCsrfField.rnrnThis function does the following:rnrn    public function ensureCsrfField(DataEvent $event)rn    {rn        $form = $event->getForm();rnrn        $options = array();rn        if ($this->intention) {rn            $options['intention'] = $this->intention;rn        }rn        if ($this->provider) {rn            $options['csrf_provider'] = $this->provider;rn        }rnrn        $form->add($this->factory->createNamed('csrf', $this->name, null, $options));rn    }rnrnNow assume that a given form is already bound and therefore validated. If we call isValid() everything is fine.rnThough, if we invoke the setData method, and call the isValid() method again an exception is thrown:rnrnYou cannot call isValid() on a form that is not bound. rnrnThis happens because the previous bounded csrf Form instance was replaced. It this the expected behaviour?rnrnThis could be solved by using $form->has before the $form->add.rnrnI solved this issue temporarly in my case by doing this (ugly thing):rnrn```javascriptrn$csrfTokenValue = $form[u201d_tokenu201d]->getData();rn$form->setData($user);rn$form[u201d_tokenu201d]->bind($csrfTokenValue);rn```

title: [Service Container] Inlining property-injected service definitions generates invalid XML
body: Hello,rnrnDefining a private service then injecting it only once will cause its definition to be dumped 'inline' when generating a cached service definitions XML file (which is expected in the dev environment). However, when this service is injected using property injection, the following error occurs:rnrn     [InvalidArgumentException]rnrn     [ERROR 1871] Element '{http://symfony.com/schema/dic/services}service':rn     This element is not expected. (in [...] /app/cache/dev/appDevDebugProjectContainer.xml [...] )rnrnThe cached services definitions XML files contains the following chunk, which is indeed invalid:rnrn      <property name=u201d[...]u201d type=u201dserviceu201d>rn        <service class=u201d[...]u201d public=u201dfalseu201d>rn          [...]rn        </service>rn      </property>rnrnYou can reproduce the issue by adding the following snippet in a services definitions XML file:rnrn    <services>rn        <service id=u201dfoou201d class=u201dStdClassu201d public=u201dfalseu201d />rn        <service id=u201dbaru201d class=u201dStdClassu201d>rn            <property name=u201dpu201d type=u201dserviceu201d id=u201dfoou201d />rn        </service>rn    </services>rnrnTemporary workaround: Make that service definition public so it does not get inlined.rnrnWhen it comes to a permanent fix, I am not sure about whether the xsd should accept inlined definitions of property-injected services (see: https://groups.google.com/group/symfony-devs/browse_thread/thread/d4ad8626db8316c3 for a somewhat related issue) or if property-injected services should just skip inlining.rnrnAll the best,rnrn-- rnmirsal

title: Percents in URL attributes are decoded thrice times
body: rnThe pathinfo is urldecoded() twice: One time in Request->getPathinfo() and a second time in UrlMatcher->match().rnrnAfter that, each individual URL attribute is decoded one more time.rnrnThis means that in an URL like `/find/{key}`, you have to encode {key} three times to get the proper value in the controller.rnrnExample when passing `%baz%` as `key` attribute value:rnrnEncoded  times | Request URI | getPathInfo() | match() | $request->get('key')rn------------------------|-------------------|--------------------|--------------|-------------------------------rn1 | `/find/%25baz%25` | `%baz%` | `ufffdz%` | `ufffdz%`rn2 | `/find/%2525baz%2525` | `%25baz%25` | `%baz%` | `ufffdz%`rn3 | `/find/%252525baz%252525` | `%2525baz%2525` | `%25baz%25` | `%baz%`rnrnI think only attributes should be decoded (once they are extracted from the URL).

title: [Form][DelegatingValidator] Duplicated error when using a DataTransformer and a NotBlank constraint
body: If a DataTransformer fails, the value is set to ``null`` in the underlying object. This is logical as we don't have any value to set in it reliably (think for instance of the case where your DataTransformer transforms an id into an object and the setter uses a typehint). But this leads to an issue if the validation has a NotBlank or NotNull constraint on the field as you will then see an error ``This value should not be blank`` on the field (which was not blank in the client data).rnrnSee #2413 for a place where this error occurs often: the repeated type.

title: [Form] Unwanted casting of numeric types allows incorrect pass of validation for AJAX posts
body: I have some properties of a deeply nested entity that need to be decimal. I have them marked up that way via the ORM Doctrine column type. Symfony2 renders an input field with a pattern attribute. rnrnI am validating via AJAX. I post over the data, use the form bindRequest to setup an instance of the entity but then use the validator service.rnrnThe thing I am finding is that if my user enters some letters 'abc' into a decimal-mapped column property, the bindRequest is setting the property to 0 (zero) rather than 'abc' so that the Type(float) constraint is always calling is_float(0) unless I specify an actual number in the field.rnrnBecause I am using AJAX, the field validates behind the scenes due to this setting of 0 rather than 'abc' but my UI stays the same. as Symfony is not called again to regenerate it like you would have if I were posting the whole page.rnrn2 options really - figure out a way of returning the modified value back to my UI in the AJAX response to reset it, or be able to tell Symfony to validate the value before setting/casting the values on my entity so that it truly validates the input and not the post-casted values.rnrnI think actually the latter is what should truly be happening. I think Symfony should not be helping me out by casting values here.

title: InvalidArgumentException when refreshing browser while user not in database
body: I am developing a site using Symfony 2.0.6.  rnWhen I load my fixtures into the database, the fixture loader deletes all users and recreates them.rnrnThe problem is when a user is logged in at the time, as is common during development.  rnrnIt returns an InvalidArgumentException with the text u201d$user must be an instanceof of UserInterface, an object implementing a __toString method, or a primitive stringu201d and nothing I do, short of clearing my cookies, will clear the error.rnrnI have tracked down the bug to SymfonyBridgeDoctrineSecurityUserEntityUserProviderrnIt returns null on the refreshUser method when there is not a user matching in the database.rnrnSubsequently, SymfonyComponentSecurityHttpFirewallContextListener::refreshUser doesn't handle null being returned from the provider and calls $token->setUser(null).  rnThis results in SymfonyComponentSecurityCoreAuthenticationTokenAbstractToken::setUser is being called with null which results in the exception being thrown.rnrnAlso, as a side note, in the throwing of the InvalidArgumentException, u201d$useru201d is not interpreted because of the use of single quotes.  Looking through the method, it seems as the Exception was put in place as an after thought because it later checks for nulls but alas never gets to that point.rnrn

In my case, when I am using a collection field as follows:rnrn```phprn$builder->add('goods', 'collection', array(rn            'type' => new GoodType(),rn            'allow_add' => true,rn            'allow_delete' => true,rn            'prototype' => true,rn            'by_reference' => falsern        ));rn```rnrnAnd a callback validatorrnrn```ymlrn constraints:rn        - Callback:rn            methods: [checkGoods]rn```rnrn```phprn    /**rn     * Callback validator for Goodsrn     * @param ExecutionContext $contextrn     */rn    public function checkGoods(SymfonyComponentValidatorExecutionContext $context) {rn        if (! is_null($this->goods) && $this->goods->count() == 0) {rn            $propertyPath = $context->getPropertyPath() . '.goods';rn            $context->setPropertyPath($propertyPath);rn            $context->addViolation('Please provide at least one good', array(), null);rn        }rn    }rn```rnrnI see the u201dPlease provide at least one goodu201d at the root of the form, wherernrn```textrn{{ form_errors(form) }} rn```rnrnis called, but I expect it to be output with the field itself, presumably in the div that contains the data-prototype definition.

title: [Form] FullTransformer DateTime binding exception is not caught in SymfonyComponentFormForm
body: # Problemrnrn**SymfonyComponentLocaleStubDateFormatFullTransformer** **parse** method throws **InvalidArgumentException** when the date format does not match.rnrn```rn    public function parse(DateTime $dateTime, $value)rn    {rn        $reverseMatchingRegExp = $this->getReverseMatchingRegExp($this->pattern);rn        $reverseMatchingRegExp = '/^'.$reverseMatchingRegExp.'$/';rnrn        $options = array();rnrn        if (preg_match($reverseMatchingRegExp, $value, $matches)) {rn            $matches = $this->normalizeArray($matches);rnrn            foreach ($this->transformers as $char => $transformer) {rn                if (isset($matches[$char])) {rn                    $length = strlen($matches[$char]['pattern']);rn                    $options = array_merge($options, $transformer->extractDateOptions($matches[$char]['value'], $length));rn                }rn            }rnrn            return $this->calculateUnixTimestamp($dateTime, $options);rn        }rnrn        throw new InvalidArgumentException(sprintf(u201dFailed to match value '%s' with pattern '%s'u201d, $value, $this->pattern));rn    }rnrn```rnrnThis exception is not caught in **SymfonyComponentFormForm** and form binding fails.rnrn# DescriptionrnYou can easily reproduce this bug while using **datetime form field** with **widget=single_text** option by entering wrong date. When you try to bind request data to form, fatal error occurs.rnrn# Possible solutionrn* Standartize exceptions used in data transformersrn* Catch those exceptions while binding form data, possibly bind **null** to form field value.rn

title: CollectionValidator fails to validate ArrayAccess because array_key_exists is used
body: # ProblemrnCollectionValidator uses array_key_exists to find missing fieldrnrn**vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/Validator/Constraints/CollectionValidator.php**rnrn```rn        foreach ($constraint->fields as $field => $constraints) {rn            if (array_key_exists($field, $value)) {rn                // cannot simply cast to array, because then the object is converted to anrn                // array instead of wrapped insidern                $constraints = is_array($constraints) ? $constraints : array($constraints);rnrn                foreach ($constraints as $constr) {rn                    $walker->walkConstraint($constr, $value[$field], $group, $propertyPath.'['.$field.']');rn                }rnrn                unset($extraFields[$field]);rn            } else {rn                $missingFields[] = $field;rn            }rn        }rn```rnrn# DescriptionrnI'm using a so-called **POJO** as a form data class. rnTo enable validation, I'm using CollectionValidator**rnOf course, to make it work with my form data class, I extend it from **ArrayAccess** and Traversablern**CollectionValidator** uses **array_key_exists**, which is buggy and does not work with **ArrayAccess**rnrnhttps://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=34849rnhttps://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=41727rn

title: Only first attribute is considered in the ACL Voter
body: I am not sure if this is a bug or if I am misunderstanding how the ACL Voter works, but it looks like the ACL voter only considers the first attribute that returns a valid mask. rnThe reason is that the vote function is wrapped in a large foreach statement, and inside the loop, the function can return granted, abstained, or denied. These votes are straight returns, and so potentially the remaining attributes will not be processed by the loop. rnrnClass: Symfony/Component/Security/Acl/Voter/AclVoter

title: Service definition without any parameters create call to getDefaultParameters without implementation
body: I have an XML definition of my services (not an SF2 app, only the DIC is in use ATM).rnrnWhile there are no parameters in the services definition, the PhpDumper creates a constructor such as this:rnrnparent::__construct(new ParameterBag($this->getDefaultParameters()));rnrnBut it does not create the 'getDefaultParameters' method implementation if there are no parameters. By just adding a foo=bar parameter the method will be implemented. See the addDefaultParametersMethod() method in the PhpDumper.rnrnI'm at commit 1a5e0acd02.

title: [Validator] what about to have MinCount and MaxCount validators
body: Let's say we have a bloger which can assign from one to five tags to his blog. While submiting the server should count  tags and check whether the collection in the allowed range. It can be done with `Choice` validator and `min` and `max` options. But in this case we have such problems:rnrn* It should fetch all tags from db to check that choices are valid, rn* Very hard to define callback in case of using `$repository->findAll()`rnrnFrom another side we have `MinMax` and `MinLengthMaxLength` validators but they very restrictive (the first takes only integers and second one only strings)rnrnSo I am thinking of moving count validation rules from Choice to a new validators called `MinCount` and `MaxCount`rnrnBTW I can do a PR if you find it useful.

title: _format parameter is ignored in twig render function
body: (In this example I've just added code to the AcmeDemoBundle to make it easier to reproduce): rnrnTwig code added to AcmeDemoShopBundle:Demo:index.html.twig: rn {% render 'AcmeDemoBundle:Demo:hello2' with {'_format' : 'otherformat'} %} rnrnController code added to AcmeDemoBundleControllerDemoController: rn/* @Route(u201d/hello2.{_format}u201d, name=u201d_demo_hello2u201d, defaults={u201d_formatu201d = u201ddefaultformatu201d})      rn* @Template()      rn*/     rnpublic function hello2Action($_format)     {   rn      return array('_format' => $_format);     rn} rnrnWhen the Twig template calls the render function the _format parameter is ignored and the controller always see u201dhtmlu201d instead 'otherformat' (specified in the render function).

title: [HttpFoundation] UploadedFile needs Locale parameter to pass
body: Because function basename() is locale aware, the constructor need to pass a locale parameter and set it in constructor. Without setting a locale non-latin first characters cut off from beginning until a latin letter or a non-letter character found in the name.rnrnfrom HttpFoundationFileUploadedFile.phprnrn      rn        $this->originalName = basename($originalName);rn        $this->mimeType = $mimeType ?: 'application/octet-stream';rn        $this->size = $size;rn        $this->error = $error ?: UPLOAD_ERR_OK;rn        $this->test = (Boolean) $test;rnrn        parent::__construct($path, UPLOAD_ERR_OK === $this->error);rn    }rnrnShould be like this (an example):rn        setlocale(LC_ALL, 'ru_RU.UTF8');rn        $this->originalName = basename($originalName);rn        $this->mimeType = $mimeType ?: 'application/octet-stream';rn        $this->size = $size;rn        $this->error = $error ?: UPLOAD_ERR_OK;rn        $this->test = (Boolean) $test;rnrn        parent::__construct($path, UPLOAD_ERR_OK === $this->error);rn    }

Without setting a locale non-latin first characters cut off from beginning until a latin letter or a non-letter character found in the name.rnrnfrom HttpFoundationFileUploadedFile.phprnrn      rn        $this->originalName = basename($originalName);rn        $this->mimeType = $mimeType ?: 'application/octet-stream';rn        $this->size = $size;rn        $this->error = $error ?: UPLOAD_ERR_OK;rn        $this->test = (Boolean) $test;rnrn        parent::__construct($path, UPLOAD_ERR_OK === $this->error);rn    }rnrnShould be like this (an example):rn        setlocale(LC_ALL, 'ru_RU.UTF8');rn        $this->originalName = basename($originalName);rn        $this->mimeType = $mimeType ?: 'application/octet-stream';rn        $this->size = $size;rn        $this->error = $error ?: UPLOAD_ERR_OK;rn        $this->test = (Boolean) $test;rnrn        parent::__construct($path, UPLOAD_ERR_OK === $this->error);rn    }

title: [Form][Collection] formtypes dont fire *set_data events when used in collection
body: Even though i donu2019t really know if this is a bug or a misuse of the collection type by me i add this as an issue:rnrnI have an OrganisationType and a PersonType. As the organisation has a lot of persons associated the OrganisationType includes a collection with the type PersonType.rnrnWhat i wanted to do is set the PersonTypes forms label to a value of the underlying object. The problem is, that this object is never passed to the arguments part of the buildForm function. Adding formevents like pre_set_data or set_data aren`t working too. theyu2019re just never called.rnrnwhen i started to look around in the collectiontype i noticed the added eventsubscriber of class [1]. in line 92 this class iterates over the passed data as part of a pre_set_data event. what it never does is passing the value of the data (in this case an object of my class Person) to the collections type. i actually merges some default options with array_replace but not the data itself. when i add a u201ddatau201d => $value to this array_replace function my PersonType suddenly works without any problems.rnrnso i guess the u201ddatau201d => $value part is missing as part of the array_replace function and i therefor report it as a bug.rnrnfeel free to let me know that Iu2019m totally wrong ;)rnrn[1] SymfonyComponentFormExtensionCoreEventListenerResizeFormListener

title: Profile is stored twice
body: Since the latest refctoring of the ProfilerListener, the main profile is saved twice, which leads to logging a warning the second time saying ``Unable to store the profiler information`` as the file already exists.rnrnThis can easily be seen by doing this change in the profiler and looking at the logs. The main profile will appear twice.rnrn```patchrndiff --git a/src/Symfony/Component/HttpKernel/Profiler/Profiler.php b/src/Symfony/Component/HttpKernel/Profiler/Profiler.phprnindex d66b70f..0a33b3b 100644rn--- a/src/Symfony/Component/HttpKernel/Profiler/Profiler.phprn+++ b/src/Symfony/Component/HttpKernel/Profiler/Profiler.phprn@@ -88,6 +88,7 @@ class Profilerrn      */rn     public function saveProfile(Profile $profile)rn     {rn+        $this->logger->info(sprintf('Saving profile %s', $profile->getToken()));rn         if (!($ret = $this->storage->write($profile)) && null !== $this->logger) {rn             $this->logger->warn('Unable to store the profiler information.');rn         }rn```

title: Problem with form validator for numeric and integer type
body: I discover 2 issues in form framework for the validator for numeric and integer fields. In my form, i have 1 field with interger  type and another with  numeric type.rnrnWhen I bind the value 'Abc'  for the  numeric field, I had an exception : in the transform() method : rnrn[2011-10-12 15:41:13] request.CRITICAL: SymfonyComponentFormExceptionUnexpectedTypeException: Expected argument of type u201dnumericu201d, u201dbooleanu201d given (uncaught exception) at C:wampwwwmenuvendorsymfonysrcSymfonyComponentFormExtensionCoreDataTransformerNumberToLocalizedStringTransformer.php line 73 [] []rnrnSo I can't perform the isValid() Method.rnrnWhen I bind the value 'Abc' for the integer field, I don't had an exception, but the string is converted  to 0. So when I perform the isValid() method, the form is valid.rnrn

title: Session locale never used
body: The new `LocaleListener` will only read the locale from the session if `$request->hasPreviousSession()` returns true. The call to this method always returns false because the `SessionListener` has not been notified yet and the session object has not been injected into the request.rnrnThe listener priorities are:rnrn * `LocaleListener`: 255rn * `SessionListener`: 128rnrnChanging these so the `SessionListener` is notified first would fix this issue.

title: route requirements for _locale parameter are ignored
body: It seems that route requirements for the `_locale` parameter aren't effective any longer. E.g. although `de|en` is required, one can use `ru` or `whatever` for that parameter without an error, and this value is then subsequently used for generating URLs. May be due to 74bc699b270122b70b1de6ece47c726f5df8bd41, but I'm not sure.

title: Strange behaviour with some non-existent commands
body: I just noticed something strange.rnrnI was working with the console, trying to execute **doctrine:database:create**, so instead, I've typed **d:d:c**. Here's what I got:rnrn    [ErrorException]                                                                                                                        rn    Notice: Undefined index: d:d in /home/alessandro/projects/Papers/vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/Console/Application.php line 491rnrnThis happens with some other commands, like **a:b:c**. However **b:c:d** throws an **InvalidArgumentException** as expected:rnrn    [InvalidArgumentException]                             rn    There are no commands defined in the u201db:cu201d namespace.rnrnI think the console shouldn't throw any PHP error at all, and I don't understand why this happens only with some namespaces.

title: [Routing] Import prefix can conflict with route patterns
body: I believe this is a result 5c8a2fb48dfe09537db6ebdd77a52a3c90f409fe, which was a fix for #2139.rnrnI have the following in my app's `routing.yml`:rnrn```ymlrnbackend:rn    resource:   @MyBundle/Resources/config/routing/backend.ymlrn    prefix:     /backendrnrnbackend_homepage:rn  pattern: /backendrn  defaults: { _controller: MyBundle:Backend:index }rn```rnrnThis causes the `backend_homepage` route to be dropped after compilation, presumably because it conflicts with the import prefix. This would be understandable if the imported file had a route with `pattern: /`, but it does not (all routes have lengthy patterns).rnrnIf I reverse the order and define `backend_homepage` before the first import with `prefix: /backend`, everything is fine. Still, I consider this a work-around, as the prefix should logically not be responsible for dropping another route which really has no pattern conflict.

title: [Form][Collection] collection field type error output
body: Hello,rnrnI'm having a problem with collection field type. If I set error_bubbling to false in order to display errors next to collection field label I will get these errors output twice. Seems that errors get written in form_row and then in form_widget:rnrn```htmlrn{% block collection_widget %}rn{% spaceless %}rn    {% if prototype is defined %}rn        {% set attr = attr|merge({'data-prototype': form_row(prototype) }) %}rn    {% endif %}rn    {{ block('form_widget') }}rn{% endspaceless %}rn```rnThe following fix worked for mernrn```htmlrn{% block collection_row %}rn{{ form_label(form) }}rn{{ form_widget(form) }}rn{% endblock %}rn```rnBTW why render forms with form_widget instead of form_row? The problem was generally caused by this and at first glance the form_row approach seems more consistent (in regard field types).

title: [Form] Label should not render field attributes
body: Label should not render field attributesrnrn`->add('test', 'email', array('attr' => array('novalidate' => 'novalidate')))`rnrnRender :rnrn``` htmlrn<label novalidate=u201dnovalidateu201d for=u201dform_testu201d class=u201d requiredu201d>Test</label>rn<input type=u201demailu201d id=u201dform_testu201d name=u201dform[test]u201d required=u201drequiredu201d    novalidate=u201dnovalidateu201d value=u201du201d />rn```rnrnExpect :rnrn``` htmlrn<label for=u201dform_testu201d class=u201d requiredu201d>Test</label>rn<input type=u201demailu201d id=u201dform_testu201d name=u201dform[test]u201d required=u201drequiredu201d    novalidate=u201dnovalidateu201d value=u201du201d />rn```

title: XLIFF loader behavior problematic
body: Right now, the behavior of the XLIFF loader is to use the content of the ``<source>`` element as the id, and not the id attribute of the ``<trans-unit>`` element. This creates problems for people that adhere to the specification where the id is meaningful.rnrnFor example:rnrn```xmlrn<trans-unit id=u201dform.label.firstnameu201d>rn    <source>Firstname</source>rn</trans-unit>rn```rnrnThe loader would now take u201dFirstnameu201d as id, and not u201dform.label.firstnameu201d as you would expect. Since changing this would be a BC break, I'd like to know what others think about this?

title: TwigExtractor does not always extract id from trans filter
body: Currently, the TwigExtractor cannot extract translations if the filter is not applied within a print node such asrnrn```html+jinjarn{{ form_widget(form, {u201dsthu201d: u201dfoo.baru201d|trans }) }}rn```

title: Form labels are not being extracted
body: Right now, there is no extractor for form labels that have been defined in the type class.

title: PhpExtractor does only work on view files
body: The extractor specifically does not pick up when you use the translator in your Controller:rnrn```phprn<?phprnclass MyController extends ContainerAwarern{rn    public function myAction()rn    {rn        $this->container->get('translator')->trans(...);rn    }rn}

title: [CookieJar] Cookies with same name on different (sub)domains overwrite each other
body: Originally posted here: https://github.com/fabpot/Goutte/issues/23#issuecomment-2126475rnrnrnI'm trying to crawl a url that's part of a signon process, which issues a couple of redirects, in combination with cookies:rnrn1: subdomain1.domain.tld => sets `session_id` cookie, issues 302 redirect to subdomain2rn2: subdomain2.domain.tld => sets `session_id` cookie, issues 302 redirect to subdomain1rn3: subdomain1.domain.tld => issues 302 redirect to the final pagernrnThe first 2 steps work fine, but as a result of the second url, the `session_id` cookie overwrites the first one, even though it's on a different subdomain. When requesting the third url, the (required) `session_id` cookie is not being sent, because it is stored as belonging to the second subdomain, while the request is for the first subdomain.

title: [Form][Collection] Form binding incorrectly handles nested collections
body: 3 duff entities:rn* Menu contains an ArrayCollection (manytomany, cascade: persist, remove) of Dish itemsrn* Dish contains an ArrayCollection (manytomany, cascade: persist, remove) of Ingredient items.rn* Ingredient.rnrneach entity has an 'id' and a 'name' attribute.rnThus Menu contains a collection of collections of ingredients.rnrnWhen I persist a Menu object from my form I get an error in Doctrine entity persist():rnrn> Warning: spl_object_hash() expects parameter 1 to be object, array given in [..]/Symfony/vendor/doctrine/lib/Doctrine/ORM/UnitOfWork.php line 1229rnrnbecause the Dish elements inside the Menu are arrays instead of Dish objects. To check it, I've added this test code:rnrn```phprn// SecuredController.php line 59rn$form->bindRequest($request);rnif ($form->isValid()) {rn         $dishes = $menu->getDishes(); // ArrayCollectionrn         $dish = $dishes->current();  // should be a Dish objectrn               throw new Exception('object: '.is_object($dish).' - array: '.is_array($dish));rn```rnrnYou get: u201dobject: - array: 1u201d.rnrnThis is a blocking issue for me as I can't implement nested collections at all.rnrnrnTo reproduce:rnrnCode can be found in: http://www.doctrine-project.org/jira/secure/attachment/11062/DemoBundle.tar.gzrn (I initially posted this problem as Doctrine issue then I realised it was with the form binding)rnrn* fresh Symfony 2.0.1 install with vendorsrn* extract DemoBundle.tar.gz into Symfony/src/Acme/ (replace existing folder: my test case is mixed with the default AcmeDemoBundle)rn* create the schema: php app/console doctrine:schema:createrngo to http:// [yourserver] /app_dev.php/demo/secured/collection and play with the form, adding Dishes.

title: Wrong date when using the stub intl
body: When using the stub intl implementation, a date field using ``IntlDateFormatter::SHORT`` will parse ``09/14/11`` as a date of the year 11 instead of 2011, thus breaking the handling of the form. When using the real intl, the date is parsed properly.

title: Asset helper broken when using use_forward in the firewall
body: When using ``use_forward`` in the firewall, the forwarded request only contains the path, but not the base url (neither the host and the port). Because of this, the asset helper is broken as it does not add the base path.rnrnNote that the routing works to add the needed path as it is in the container scope and s has been initialized in the master request.

title: transchoice should allow an empty value for an interval
body: It can be worked around, but I have run into a case where I wanted to have an empty string be returned from transchoice when the count was 0 and this is not currently possible with the way the interval messages are parsed in src/Symfony/Component/Translation/MessageSelector.php (gobbles all whitespace after the interval value and requires at least one non-whitespace character after that).

title: [Bug]Inconsistent PathInfo parsing/checking
body: I have found an Bug regarding some inconsistency in how Symfony2 proccesses URI's.rnrnThe problem occured for me when I used some domainstring, wich got some special characters translated into the URI notation.rnrnAll the time my routing failed I got a u201dGET hpu201d while trying to get on my server using rnrn```rnhttp://localhost/~blackskyliner/Symfony SVN/trunk/web/app_dev.phprn```rnrnI isolated the point when and where the bug happens.rnrnFirst I want to show, in a short snippet, what actually happens.rnrn```phprn<?phprn$requestUri = u201d/~blackskyliner/Symfony%20SVN/trunk/web/app_dev.phpu201d;rn$baseUrl = u201d/~blackskyliner/Symfony SVN/trunk/web/app_dev.phpu201d;rn$pathInfo = u201d/u201d;rnrn$pathInfo = substr($requestUri, strlen($baseUrl));rnrnecho $pathInfo; // hp get's echoed instead of an empty string... leading to an fake GET request to a route called hp...rn```rnrnrnrnThis all happens in the u201dpreparePathInfo()u201d function of the u201dSymfonyComponentHttpFoundationRequestu201d class of Symfony2 - in an if statement but it happens.rnrnSo for me it seems there is some lack of consistency for checking the domainstring for routing purposes.rnBoth parameters should be encoded or decoded, so there is an consistent handling.

title: For duplicate routes, matcher dumps both, generator only the second
body: Hey guys!rnrnI've noticed a possible inconsistency today. The setup is simple: import two routes with the same name but different patterns from different resource files (so that they don't YAML-override). For example:rnrn    # some routing.yml that's importedrn    foo_page:rn        pattern:  /foorn        defaults: { _controller: MainBundle:Default:homepage }rnrn    # some other routing.yml that's importedrn    foo_page:rn        pattern:  /second-foo-pagern        defaults: { _controller: MainBundle:Default:homepage }rnrn* when the matcher is dumped, both routes appear, but the first pattern appears firstrn* when the generator is dumped, only the second route appears, and is used for all generationrnrnI believe the proper behavior should be that only the second route is used in the matcher, to be consistent with the dumper. rnrnThanks!

title: [Form] Fix u201dpatternu201d option for date field type
body: This pull request adds the u201dpatternu201d option to the date field type. It was documented (http://symfony.com/doc/current/reference/forms/types/date.html) but apparently not implemented. The value was simply ignored and replaced with an automatically generated value that matched the locale.rnrnAs far as I can see this fixes both #1730 and #1967.rnrnThe behaviour should now be exactly as documented here: http://symfony.com/doc/current/reference/forms/types/date.html#pattern

title: Form - problem with data => 0
body: HirnrnI've discovered a bug when using a form not related to an entity (when the form is related to an entity, this does not happen in the few tests I have done)rnrnwhen adding a field to a form like this :rn$builder->add('test', 'number', array('data' => 0)) // 0 as intrnor like thisrn$builder->add('test', 'number', array('data' => '0')) // 0 as stringrnrnthe value of the rendered input is set to u201du201d (empty) instead of being u201d0u201d as expectedrnrnnote : the problems occurs for all types, not only number, but also text and textarea for what I've testedrnalso note that when data => '00' or with more zero, the value is correctly rendered as 0

title: [Form][DelegatingValidator] RepeatedType error keeps on bubbling to root form
body: When RepeatedType is nested inside another form, error messages such as u201dThis value should not be blanku201d bubble up to the root form, instead of appearing above the field in the nested form.rnrnTo illustrate this issue, I have put together the following example:rnrn* Two types where one is nested in the other (child inside parent).rn* Both types have the RepeatedType field.rn* Both RepeatedType fields are NotBlank.rnrnAs you can see, the error message for the RepeatedType in the main type, appears right above the fields, but this doesn't happen for the nested type.rnrn![Screenshot](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-J-fC_SSILqM/Tkh8HkaFA9I/AAAAAAAAABg/rhRPP52nizQ/screenshot.png)rnrnHere are the types and models that can be used to demonstrate the issue:rnrn    class RegistrationParentrn    {rn        public $registrationChild;rnrn        /**rn         * @AssertNotBlank()rn         */rn        public $plainPassword;rn    }rnrnrn    class RegistrationChildrn    {rn        /**rn         * @AssertNotBlank()rn         */rn        public $plainPassword;rn    }rnrnrn    class RegistrationParentFormType extends AbstractTypern    {rn       public function buildForm(FormBuilder $builder, array $options)rn       {rn       $builderrn          ->add('registrationChild', new RegistrationChildFormType())rn          ->add('plainPassword', 'repeated', array(rn             'type' => 'password',rn          ))rn       ;rn     }rnrnrn    class RegistrationChildFormType extends AbstractTypern    {rn       public function buildForm(FormBuilder $builder, array $options)rn       {rn          $builderrn             ->add('plainPassword', 'repeated', array(rn                'type' => 'password',rn             ))rn          ;rn     }rn

title: [Form] Specify date pattern
body:
When I specify a date pattern like this :rnrnrn->add('h4', 'date', array(t'label'tt=>t'Date of bird',rn ttttt'widget't=>t'choice',rn ttttt'pattern't=>t'{{ day }}/{{ month }}/{{ year }}',rnrnthe result isn't Day/Month/Year but Year-Month-Day.rnrnIn the form_div_layout.html.twig, the block date_widget use u201ddate_patternu201d and not u201dpatternu201d. So, I changed u201ddate_patternu201d to u201dpatternu201d and now I have the good result Day/Month/Year.rnrnrn{% block date_widget %}rn{% spaceless %}rn {% if widget == 'single_text' %}rn {{ block('field_widget') }}rn {% else %}rn
rn {{ date_pattern|replace({rn '{{ year }}': form_widget(form.year),rn '{{ month }}': form_widget(form.month),rn '{{ day }}': form_widget(form.day),rn })|raw }}rn
rn {% endif %}rn{% endspaceless %}rn{% endblock date_widget %}rnrnrnto rnrnrn{% block date_widget %}rn{% spaceless %}rn {% if widget == 'single_text' %}rn {{ block('field_widget') }}rn {% else %}rn
rn {{ pattern|replace({rn '{{ year }}': form_widget(form.year),rn '{{ month }}': form_widget(form.month),rn '{{ day }}': form_widget(form.day),rn })|raw }}rn
rn {% endif %}rn{% endspaceless %}rn{% endblock date_widget %}rnrnrnI don't know if this bug was fixed and if my solution is the good.

title: Chain user provider doesn't search in all user providers
body: I commit these changes because Chain user provider doesn't search in all user providers.rnrnExample with the Acme/DemoBundle:rnrn    // security.ymlrn    ...rn        providers:rn            chain_provider:rn                providers: [in_memory, in_memory_extend]rn            in_memory_extend:rn                users:rn                    admin2: { password: adminpass2, roles: [ 'ROLE_ADMIN' ] }rn            in_memory:rn                users:rn                    user:  { password: userpass, roles: [ 'ROLE_USER' ] }rn    ...rn        firewalls:rn    ...rn            secured_area:rn                pattern:    ^/demo/secured/rn                provider: chain_provider OR in_memory_extendrn    ...rnrnWe can see these logs :rnrn    security.INFO: User u201dadmin2u201d has been authenticated successfully [] []rn    security.DEBUG: Write SecurityContext in the session [] []rn    security.DEBUG: Read SecurityContext from the session [] []rn    security.DEBUG: Reloading user from user provider. [] []rn    security.WARNING: Username u201dadmin2u201d could not be found. [] []rnrnThe new code search in others user providers when a user is not found in the first user provider and throws the right exception.

title: An exception is thrown when the firewall matches a inexistent url and try to redirect to a route using the locale

title: Incomplete YAML DI loader
body: The YAML DI loader does no have the equivalent of ``on-invalid=u201dnullu201d``, only ``on-invalid=u201dignoreu201d``. Unfortunately, ignoring the argument is only possible for the last one as you cannot omit an optional argument when passing the next one.rnrnSee https://github.com/nelmio/NelmioSecurityBundle/commit/b3ac56a7f102d3f1c12373e4d10eb150c2bde9da#diff-4 for instance, which is broken when the logger does not exist and the router exists. the only way to fix it currently is to switch the service definition to XML.

title: Fixed: Notice: Undefined index: enable_annotations in ...
Missing method in the RouterInterface
body: Currently, the RouterInterface contains only 3 methods: ``match``, ``generate`` and ``setContext`` (inherited from the other routing interfaces). But Symfony also uses the ``getRouteCollection`` method (part of the actual implementation) in several places where it uses the router: the ``router:debug`` and ``router:dump-apache`` commands. These commands are broken without this method, and using a Dumper is virtually impossible when using only the interface (you cannot get the RouteCollection).rnBtw, this method is also a requirement to be able to implement https://github.com/Bazinga/BazingaExposeRoutingBundle (which also uses the method which is not part of the interface).rnrnI suggest adding the method in the interface to make it possible to accept any implementation of the interface in places asking for the router.

title: $_format is lost on failure_forward
body: I've been debugging this for the past few days but to no avail.rnrnThis is the excerpt from my security file:rnrn```rnsecurity:rn    firewalls:rn        default_json:rn            poshtar_login:rn                login_path: /login.jsonrn                check_path: /login.jsonrn                failure_forward: truern            context: storern            anonymous:  ~rn            logout:     { path: /logout }rn            pattern:    /.*rn            provider:   poshtarrn```rnrnWhat I was able to figure out using a debugger is that the content type for subresponse? is set correctly to json, but sometime later, when responses get merged? and the request is asked again for a format the request returns html as the attributes bag is empty (controller resolver set the proper format in subrequest) so data sent to the browser has a wrong content type.

title: http basic authentication broken with PHP as cgi/fastCGI under Apache
body: The keys PHP_AUTH_USER and PHP_AUTH_PW are not present in the superglobal $_SERVER, so http basic authentication needs to be handled a little differently.rnrnThis also affects functional tests which require http basic auth to authenticate.rnrnBasically the workaround is two parts:rnrn1. A rewrite rule to pack the username and password into an environment variable:rnrn    <IfModule mod_rewrite.c>rn        RewriteEngine onrn        RewriteRule .* - [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%{HTTP:Authorization},L]rn    </IfModule>rnrn2. Extract the info from the environment variable:rnrn    list($_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_USER'], $_SERVER['PHP_AUTH_PW']) = explode(':' , base64_decode(substr($_SERVER['HTTP_AUTHORIZATION'], 6)));rnrnrnSee below for more details.rnrnhttp://orangejuiceliberationfront.com/http-auth-with-php-in-cgi-mode-e-g-on-dreamhost/rnhttp://www.besthostratings.com/articles/http-auth-php-cgi.htmlrnrnrn

title: infinite loop when deleting a logged user from the database or disabling it
body: If I delete the logged user from the database (in my case, it was because I cleared the database by reloading the fixtures), the next request sent to the site will try to authenticate this user in the ContextListener (as the browser still has the cookie) and fail (as the user does not exist anymore). But the cookie is not deleted. This leads to some weird behavior in some cases:rnrn- remove the user from the database (without clearing the cookie in your browser)rn- go to the signup page and recreate the user with this username, but as a disabled user (waiting for a confirmation sent through a mail)rn- the next requests will redirect to the login page because it finds the user again but disabled, which throws an AuthenticationException (and then an infinite loop as the same occur for the request to the login page).rnrnIf the cookie were removed when the user cannot be reloaded (not found or disabled), the next requests would match an anonymous token which would work.rnrn

title: `@UniqueEntity` not handling composite key made of related entity
body: `@UniqueEntity` doesn't properly handle composite keys when one of them is a related entity. The database throws `Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry` when trying to persist an entity with the same company and name as an already existing one. Expected behavior is that `@UniqueEntity`'s validator blocks persisting the (duplicate) entity. Here's such an entity to illustrate the issue:rnrn```rn/**rn * @ORMEntityrn * @ORMTable(name=u201dmy_useru201d,rn * tuniqueConstraints={@ORMUniqueConstraint(columns={rn * ttu201dcompany_idu201d, u201dnameu201drn * t})}rn * )rn * @UniqueEntity(fields={u201dcompanyu201d, u201dnameu201d})rn */rnclass MyUser {rnrnt/**rnt * @ORMColumn(name=u201didu201d, type=u201dintegeru201d, nullable=false)rnt * @ORMIdrnt * @ORMGeneratedValue(strategy=u201dAUTOu201d)rnt */rntprotected $id;rnrnt/**rnt * @ORMManyToOne(targetEntity=u201dCompanyu201d, inversedBy=u201dmyUsersu201d)rnt * @ORMJoinColumn(name=u201dcompany_idu201d, referencedColumnName=u201didu201d, nullable=false)rnt * @AssertNotNullrnt */rntprotected $company;rnrnt/**rnt * @ORMColumn(name=u201dnameu201d, type=u201dstringu201d, nullable=false)rnt * @AssertNotBlankrnt */rntprotected $name;rnrnt// setters and getters omittedrnrn}rn```

title: incomplete date field validation
body: A mandatory date form field (consisting of three select parts for day, month, year; with `empty_value` defined) is considered as valid server-side if a value for at least one of the three parts is chosen. This results in `1970-01-01` if only day `1` is selected while the other fields are left empty. Client-side HTML5 form validation correctly wants all three parts to be filled which means you have to override it to test this.rnrnSame may apply to time and date/time fields, but I haven't tested that yet.

title: [Security&Session] Bug: Session token is not refreshed upon change of user data
body: Changing user data does not reflect in the (session) token.rnrnUse-case (reverse this for a possible security vulnerability):rn1) Login (non-admin) userrn2) Through some action, add ROLE_ADMIN to user, persistrn3) Role ROLE_ADMIN prerequisite actions are unavailable until logout+loginrnrnProblem:rnRole requirements are taken from session, which holds serialized state of SomeToken. SomeToken is created upon successful u201dlogin_checku201d, being immutable afterwards (until next signin)

title: [DomCrawler] support for foo[] fields
body: The current DomCrawler component does not support field names that end in `[]`:rnrn```phprn<?phprnrn$form['favorite_colors[]'] = array('red', 'orange', 'yellow');rn$form['favorite_colors[]'][] = 'purple';rn```

title: [Form][Collection] Collection type is broken
body: The collection type is broken when using it for the inversed side of a Doctrine relation as it modifies the collection instead of calling some setter in the class. As Doctrine does not track changes in the inversed side, the changes are not persisted.rnrnThe best practice for Doctrine is to call the setter of the owning side in the setter of the inversed side. But as the setter is not called, this has no effect for the forms. And there is currently no way to change this behavior in user-land forms.rnrnI suggested in #1141 to allow defining the setter used. A collection type should then call ``addXXX`` and ``removeXXX`` on the object instead of modifying the collection to allow having additionnal logic when adding and removing elements.

body: I have two entities in my Bundle, `Poll` and `Answer`.rnWhen creating a poll you can assign multiple answers to it. rnrnPoll has a one-to-many relationship with Answer and this is inverted by Answer.rnrnSo Poll object has a protected property `Poll::$answers` with is an ArrayCollection and the Answer object has a protected property `Answer::$poll` which is a `Poll` object.rnrnWith a single form i want to be able to save the poll and the answers all in one go.rnrnProgrammatically saving a new poll with two answers works perfect, all three instances are persisted in the database:rnrnt$poll = new Poll();rnt$poll->setBody('What is your gender?');rnt$poll->addAnswer( new Answer(u201dMaleu201d) );rnt$poll->addAnswer( new Answer(u201dFemaleu201d) );rntrnt$em = $this->getDoctrine()->getEntityManager();rnt$em->persist($poll);rnt$em->flush();rnrnBut when i create a new Poll form with two answers by default and the user fills in all form fields i get an error message saying **This form should not contain extra fields**:rnrnt$entity = new Poll();rnt$entity->addAnswer( new Answer() );rnt$entity->addAnswer( new Answer() );rnrnt$form   = $this->createForm(new PollType(), $entity);rnrntreturn array(rnt    'entity' => $entity,rnt    'form'   => $form->createView()rnt);rnrn

$ca->getCompanyName());rnrn      $ca->setCompanyName(null);rn      $this->em->persist($ca);rn      $this->em->flush();rnrn      $ca = $this->em->getRepository('CompanySellerBundleEntityCustomerAccount')rn                     ->findOneBy(array ('email' => self::EBAY_FREE_USER_EMAIL));rnrn      $this->assertTrue(null === $ca->getCompanyName());rnrn      $ca->setCompanyName('company');rn      $this->em->persist($ca);rn      $this->em->flush();rnrn      //$this->em->clear();rnrn      $ca = $this->em->getRepository('CompanySellerBundleEntityCustomerAccount')rn                     ->findOneBy(array ('email' => self::EBAY_FREE_USER_EMAIL));rnrn      $this->assertTrue('company' === $ca->getCompanyName());rn   }rnrn   public function testNullAffectationOnProxyEntity()rn   {rn      $crawler = $this->client->request('GET', $this->client->getContainer()->get('router')->generate('_home'));rn      $this->assertIdTag('_security_login', $crawler);rnrn      $form = $crawler->selectButton('loginFormSubmit')->form();rn      $form['login[loginName]'] = self::EBAY_FREE_USER_EMAIL;rn      $form['login[password]'] = self::EBAY_FREE_USER_EMAIL;rn      $crawler = $this->client->submit($form);rnrn      sleep(5);rnrn title: Login Form's u201d_target_pathu201d assumes paths to be relative
body: My login form (which resides at `/MyApp/web/admin/login`) contains:rnrn    <input type=u201dhiddenu201d name=u201d_target_pathu201d value=u201d{{ path('admin.home') }}u201d />rnrn(`/MyApp/web/admin/` is the value for `_target_path`).rnrnSymfony instead redirects to `/MyApp/web/MyApp/web/admin`.  (Basically, *base path* + *redirect path*)rnrnIn short, the redirect doesn't work correctly if you have a Symfony application in a nested folder of another site.rnrnChecking for a `/` prefix would suffice.rnrn

title: [Form] Bind: clientData not updated if parent is u201dformu201d
body: Inside bind() function, clientData is updated for every children if transformer data does not throw exception. It's work only if parent's child is u201dfieldu201d (Ex: It works with IntegerType but not with DateType)nn```phpn$form = $this->get('form.factory')n->createBuilder('form', $car)n->add('category', 'my_type')n->getForm();nn$form_view = $form->createView();n```nnparent's my_type is u201dformu201d (getParent() returns u201dformu201d). my_tape adds two fields: u201dkeyu201d and u201dtextu201d. my_type has a client converter which tranforms object entity to array (keys:  u201dkeyu201d and u201dtextu201d)nnIf a user sends u201dform[category][key] = 1 and form[category][text] = cat2nAFTER the call of bind() function, my form object looks like :nn|--clientDatan|-----categoryn|----------id              [Value: 1]n|----------name               [Value: cat1]n|--childrenn|-----categoryn|----------clientDatan|---------------key               [Value: 1]n|---------------text               [Value: cat1 (Good value. transform() function updated this value)]n|----------chilidrenn|--------------keyn|-------------------clientData              [Value: 1]n|--------------textn|-------------------clientData              [Value: cat2 (Bad value - Old value. Value sent by user)]nn And my form_view object looks like:nn|--childrenn|-----categoryn|---------varsn|---------------valuen|--------------------key              [ Value:1]n|--------------------text               [Value: cat1 (Good value. transform() function updated this value)]n|----------chilidrenn|---------------keyn|--------------------varsn|-------------------------value               [Value: 1]n|---------------textn|--------------------varsn|-------------------------value              [ Value: cat2 (Bad value - Old value. Value sent by user)]nnnIt's a problem because form_widget() function uses u201dform.children.text.vars.valueu201d value (the bad value).

title: Lifetime of the session is not reset when accessing a secured page
body: After the login, the firewall will store the token in the session. This triggers a change in the session which updates the expiration time of the cookie. But when accessing another secured page after that, it is not updated again. This means that a user which logs in and navigates in the secured area of the site will be logged out after 1 hour (assuming the session has a lifetime configured to 1 hour) even if his latest action is only a few minutes old.

body: Hi,rnrntoday I updated from sf2 b1 to b2 SE and updated to the master branch.rnOf cause I read about the changed use of annotations in the update file and modified my creation script.rnBut now I can't generate my entities based on the database anymore.rnrnThe following command is executed like expected and generates all the entity files in my projects entity folder:rnrn    php app/console doctrine:mapping:import u201dMyXBundleu201d annotation --em=withport;rnrnThis command fails with the following error message:rnrn    php app/console doctrine:generate:entities MyXBundle/Entity;rnrnrnError message:rnrn    [DoctrineCommonAnnotationsAnnotationException]rn    [Semantical Error] The annotation u201d@orm:Tableu201d in class MyXBundleEntityXY was never imported.rnrnThe doctrine:mapping:import command still generates old syntax entities.rnrnThanks for looking into this,rnLars

title: configuration loader should detect cyclic references
body: if i define a configuration cycle (even a close one) i get into an endless recursion in ParameterBag.phprnrnit would be nice if symfony could tell me that i am stupid, and the name of the parameter it did not find.rnrnto reproduce, put this into your config.ymlrnrnparameters:rn    param_name: %param_name%rn

title: Firewall onCoreRequest not early enough to prevent exposing 404's
body: Due to the onCoreRequest ordering, you'll hit a 404 page before thefirewall forces authentication. The authentication listeners rely on being  *after* the onCoreRequest listener of the framework (for the session).rnrnConversation on the dev board here: http://groups.google.com/group/symfony-devs/browse_thread/thread/e614e9583b151221#8e1477af567dd310

title: Email validation by way of FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL behaves differently depending on PHP version/installation
body: I am receiving a test error on validating `example@localhost` as an invalid email address. It would appear that `filter_var()` with `FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL` may behave differently depending on PHP version?rnrnI'd be happy to try and fix this but would want direction on how this should behave. I would guess normalizing the results such that user@domain where domain is not fully qualified gets rejected even if it passes the `filter_var()` test.rnrnhttp://www.php.net/manual/en/filter.filters.validate.php

title: [ACL] AccessDecisionManager doesn't check if voter supports object's class
body: All methods `decide*` does not call method `$voter->supportsClass()` before voting.

title: [Security] ACL: Ancestors relations regeneration problem
body: Hi all,rnrnA couple of days ago I had an issue with the security component. Suddenly, after update some permissions I had this exception:rnrnu201dNot all parent ids were populated. This implies an integrity problem.u201drnrnI tried to track down the issue and finally I think I've found the problem. Method MutableAclProvider::regenerateAncestorRelations doesn't handle the update of the ancestors for the Acl's children. So, if some parent Acl was changed, it will not update relations between this new ancestor and the actual Acl's children. This causes the exception described before.rnrnLooking at the master version of Symfony, the problem seems to be still there.rnrnrnThanks.

title: Validator should not use Reflection to access properties
body: Validator using reflection to access properties is very bad. The validator should only be able to use public accessors to validator the object, otherwise it fiddles with the iternals of the object, breaking concernsrnrnThis happens to be a problem when validating unitizalized Doctrine proxies, which is not possible with Validator. We should change this ASAP.

title: [Security] Fix for #772
body: This change the check used in the security component as the needed one is knowing if the session is activated (to be able to set a value in it), not if a session cookie exist. It fixes #772

title: [Security] Session target_path not set when the incoming request has no session
body: ``SymfonyComponentSecurityHttpFirewallExceptionListener`` only sets the target path when ``$request->hasSession()`` is true. This is the wrong behavior IMO as it checks if there is a previous session instead of checking if the session is activated in the project (which would be done by checking ``null !== $request->getSession()``.rnI open the issue as @schmittjoh asked it on IRC saying he needs to check further about this.

body: For more details please read #770
